00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the control flow instructions.
00017 
00018 #include <machine.hpp>
00019 #include <instructions.hpp>
00020 
00021 namespace Instructions {
00022     
00023     /// \name Control flow
00024     /// \{
00025     
00026     /// Define the VM requirements.
00027     /**
00028      * This should be executed before any other instruction.
00029      * 
00030      * \param Int8 The export length. (This parameter is currently not used.)
00031      * \param Int8 The number of exports.
00032      * \param Int16 The number of globals.
00033      * \param Int8 The number of state variables.
00034      * \param Int16 The size of the execution stack.
00035      * \param Int8 The size of the environment stack.
00036      */
00037     void DEF_VM(Machine & machine){
00038         /*Size export_length    =*/ machine.nextInt8 (); //TODO: ...
00039         Size     exports_size = machine.nextInt8 ();
00040         Size     globals_size = machine.nextInt16();
00041         Size       state_size = machine.nextInt8 ();
00042         Size       stack_size = machine.nextInt16();
00043         Size environment_size = machine.nextInt8 ();
00044         
00045         machine.       hood.reset(    exports_size);
00046         machine.    globals.reset(    globals_size);
00047         machine.      state.reset(      state_size);
00048         machine.      stack.reset(    stack_size+1);
00049         machine.environment.reset(environment_size);
00050         
00051         machine.this_machine = machine.hood.add(machine.id);
00052         machine.current_neighbour = machine.hood.end();
00053         
00054         Instruction callback = machine.callbacks.pop();
00055         machine.callbacks.reset(3); //TODO: ...
00056         machine.callbacks.push(callback);
00057     }
00058     
00059     /// Exit the installation script.
00060     /**
00061      * This must be the last instruction of an installation script.
00062      */
00063     void EXIT(Machine & machine){
00064         machine.stack.push(machine.globals.peek());
00065         machine.stack.push(Data());
00066         machine.retn();
00067     }
00068     
00069     /// Return from a function.
00070     /**
00071      * \param Data The return value.
00072      * 
00073      * \return Data The return value.
00074      */
00075     void RET(Machine & machine){
00076         machine.retn();
00077     }
00078     
00079     /// Clean the stack.
00080     /**
00081      * Preserve the top element while the rest of the given range is dropped.
00082      * For example, after executing <tt>ALL_OP 3</tt> on the stack <tt>[1 2 3 4]</tt>, <tt>[1 4]</tt> is left.
00083      * 
00084      * \param Int8 The number of elements to clean up.
00085      * \param Data <tt>[n]</tt> The elements on the stack.
00086      * 
00087      * \return Data The top element.
00088      */
00089     void ALL(Machine & machine){
00090         Data data = machine.stack.peek();
00091         machine.stack.pop(machine.nextInt8());
00092         machine.stack.push(data);
00093     }
00094     
00095     /// Waste clockcycles.
00096     void NOP(Machine & machine){
00097         // No Operation
00098     }
00099     
00100     /// Pick one of two values, using a condition.
00101     /**
00102      * \param Number The condition.
00103      * \param Data The 'true' value.
00104      * \param Data The 'false' value.
00105      * 
00106      * \return Data The 'false' value when the condition is 0, the 'true' value otherwise.
00107      */
00108     void MUX(Machine & machine){
00109         Data false_value = machine.stack.pop();
00110         Data  true_value = machine.stack.pop();
00111         Number condition = machine.stack.popNumber();
00112         machine.stack.push(condition ? true_value : false_value);
00113     }
00114     
00115 #if MIT_COMPATIBILITY != NO_MIT
00116     /// \deprecated_mitproto{MUX}
00117     void VMUX(Machine & machine){
00118         Data & result = machine.globals[machine.nextInt8()];
00119         Data false_value = machine.stack.pop();
00120         Data  true_value = machine.stack.pop();
00121         Number condition = machine.stack.popNumber();
00122         machine.stack.push(result = (condition ? true_value : false_value).copy());
00123     }
00124 #endif
00125     
00126     /// A conditional jump.
00127     /**
00128      * Skips the given number of bytes if the condition is not 0.
00129      * 
00130      * \param Int8 The number of bytes to skip when the condition is true.
00131      * \param Number The condition.
00132      */
00133     void IF(Machine & machine){
00134         Size skip = machine.nextInt8();
00135         if (machine.stack.popNumber()) machine.skip(skip);
00136     }
00137     
00138     /// A conditional jump.
00139     /**
00140      * Skips the given number of bytes if the condition is not 0.
00141      * 
00142      * \param Int16 The number of bytes to skip when the condition is true.
00143      * \param Number The condition.
00144      */
00145     void IF16(Machine & machine){
00146         Size skip = machine.nextInt16();
00147         if (machine.stack.popNumber()) machine.skip(skip);
00148     }
00149     
00150     /// Jump to another address.
00151     /**
00152      * \note You can only jump forward.
00153      * 
00154      * \param Int8 the number of bytes to jump (relative).
00155      */
00156     void JMP(Machine & machine){
00157         machine.skip(machine.nextInt8());
00158     }
00159     
00160     /// Jump to another address.
00161     /**
00162      * \note You can only jump forward.
00163      * 
00164      * \param Int16 The number of bytes to jump (relative).
00165      */
00166     void JMP16(Machine & machine){
00167         machine.skip(machine.nextInt16());
00168     }
